feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it accepts financial inputs, computes specific metrics (after-tax income, saving rate, debt burden) and presents a composite score, with implemented GUI and code. The student also verified results and aligned the tool to DRIVER stages, showing thorough, functional treatment of the criterion.
- Integrate AI: The student clearly integrated AI (ChatGPT) to generate financial calculation logic and code, iterated prompts to expand functionality, and verified outputs against independent calculations. This demonstrates effective, value-adding AI integration across Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "We can do 'Analyze My Financial Health'. When you click it, it gives us kind of a nice little thing down here... it says we got about a 45 out of 100 as our ranking... after-tax income, we're looking, we're about taking $106,000 home."
"And then it kind of does like this drive. This is what I thought I would make it do, is the discover, reason, invest, verify, and explain part."

"To verify, I did take some numbers and I tried to calculate the savings rate and the debt burden rate and they would equal to what Gemini was or sorry, ChatGPT was giving, so that made me assured that all the facts and statistics and numbers that it was producing were correct."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: student defined user inputs and purpose (taxes, household, savings) demonstrating problem understanding.
- Implement: student built a GUI and code in Python to compute outputs (score, after-tax income, saving rate).
- Verify: student tested calculations against manual/ChatGPT results to validate outputs.
- Reflect: student discussed importance of taxes and how the app aids user understanding.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates a working financial application: it accepts financial inputs, computes specific metrics (after-tax income, saving rate, debt burden) and presents a composite score, with implemented GUI and code. The student also verified results and aligned the tool to DRIVER stages, showing thorough, functional treatment of the criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "for me to personally use and for anyone else to use, because that's, you know, the main point is that we have um that usability on here."
"So, all this was again sourced by ChatGPT. Um, I'll show you the code right here."

"I did take some numbers and I tried to calculate the savings rate and the debt burden rate and they would equal to what Gemini was or sorry, ChatGPT was giving, so that made me assured that all the facts and statistics and numbers that it was producing were correct."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (identified a user need for usable financial tooling), Implement (used ChatGPT to generate code/logic and integrated it into a GUI), Reflect/Verify (tested AI-generated outputs against manual calculations to confirm correctness).
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly integrated AI (ChatGPT) to generate financial calculation logic and code, iterated prompts to expand functionality, and verified outputs against independent calculations. This demonstrates effective, value-adding AI integration across Discover, Implement, and Reflect stages, meeting the PASS standard.
